required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Low-Cost, Portable Flexible Nasopharyngoscope in Head & Neck Cancers in Low Resource Settings
clinical_study.official_title: Partnership to Establish a Practice Based Network to Assess for Head and Neck Cancers Using a Low-Cost Portable Flexible Nasopharyngoscope

collaborator.agency: National Institute of Dental and Craniofacial Research (NIDCR)

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to develop and evaluate a low-cost, portable, flexible nasopharyngeal scope (FNS) used to assess head and neck cancers (HNC) in low resource settings. The FNS will be compared to the rigid endoscope that is used as standard of care in terms of ease of use, image quality, and perceived pain. The ultimate goal is to implement widespread training and use of the optimized FNS to improve care capacity by local heath providers in Vietnam through timely diagnosis, treatment and/or appropriate specialized referral for HNC patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of providers who who reported the FNS is easy to use
primary_outcome.description: Measured using a 5 point scale, with 1 = very easy, 2=easier, 3 = same, 4= harder and 5 = very hard

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of image quality of rigid scope
secondary_outcome.description: Measured using 5 point scale, with 1 being poor and 5 being excellent

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of image quality of flexible scope
secondary_outcome.description: Measured using 5 point scale, with 1 being poor and 5 being excellent

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients who reported perceived pain following use of the flexible scope
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison using a 3 point scale, with 1 being much less and 3 being much more

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients who experienced an adverse event following the use of the flexible scope
secondary_outcome.description: measured by a provider questionnaire following completion of flexible scope exam

arm_group.arm_group_label: Patients evaluated using flexible nasopharyngoscope prototype
Patients evaluated using rigid nasopharyngoscope per SOC

intervention.description: Low-cost, flexible scope prototype will compared to rigid scope used as standard of care.
intervention.arm_group_label: Patients evaluated using flexible nasopharyngoscope prototype

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Provide signed and dated informed consent form
- Willing to comply with all study procedures and be available for the duration of the study
- Male or female, aged 18 or older
- Patients who clinical meet clinical criteria for rigid scope examination of the upper aerodigestive tract. This includes signs and symptoms such as dysphagia, nasal obstruction, neck mass, throat pain, and hoarseness.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects who have complications from the SOC rigid exam
- Anything that would place the individual at increased risk or preclude the individual's full compliance with or completion of the study.
- Withdrawal of consent during the study duration
